personal.name: Bruce Blake
personal.title: Software Engineer
personal.currentFocus: Building scalable AI systems and exploring the intersection of low-level programming and high-level cloud services

summary.brief: Full-stack engineer comfortable from low-level C++ game engines to cloud-native AI services. Currently pursuing B.S. in Computer Engineering at Virginia Tech with a 3.85 GPA.
summary.detailed: I'm a software engineer who thrives at the intersection of systems programming and modern web development. My journey spans from building custom 3D physics engines in C++ to creating AI-powered solutions that generate real revenue. I believe in understanding technology from the ground up - whether that's implementing collision detection algorithms or designing distributed systems at Google scale.
summary.uniqueValue: I bring a rare combination of low-level systems understanding and high-level product thinking. While others use frameworks, I build engines. While others make demos, I create revenue-generating systems. This full-stack mastery from bare metal to cloud enables me to architect solutions that are both technically sound and business-impactful.

Integrated payment processing and order management workflows

Reduced restaurant's phone order handling time by 70%
Built system that scales to handle concurrent calls

projects.name: 3D Physics Engine & Multiplayer FPS Game
projects.description: Custom 3D game engine built from scratch in C++ with physics simulation and multiplayer support
projects.motivation: Wanted to understand game engines at a fundamental level rather than just using Unity/Unreal

technicalDetails.physics: Implemented collision detection using SAT (Separating Axis Theorem) and GJK algorithms
technicalDetails.rendering: Custom OpenGL rendering pipeline with shader management
technicalDetails.networking: Low-latency multiplayer using ENet with client-side prediction

features: Custom physics engine with realistic collision detection and response
OpenGL-based rendering pipeline with dynamic lighting and shadows
challenges: Debugging complex physics interactions and edge cases
Implementing smooth multiplayer with client prediction
outcomes: Fully functional FPS game with custom engine
Deep understanding of game engine architecture
Portfolio piece that demonstrates technical depth

projects.name: BetterRepo2File
projects.description: Intelligent tool that extracts and formats repository context for AI coding assistants
projects.motivation: AI coding assistants often lack proper context - this tool solves that by intelligently extracting relevant code

technicalDetails.parsing: AST-based code analysis for intelligent extraction
technicalDetails.testing: End-to-end tests with Playwright streaming results
technicalDetails.deployment: Containerized with Docker for reproducible environments
technicalDetails.ci_cd: GitHub Actions with automated badge generation

features: Intelligent code extraction based on dependencies
Support for multiple languages and frameworks
projects.impact: Used by developers to improve AI assistant code generation quality

projects.name: iOS Social Media Demo App
projects.description: Comprehensive iOS application demonstrating modern SwiftUI and MVVM architecture
features: User authentication with secure token management
projects.codeQuality: Clean architecture with 20k+ lines of maintainable code

projects.name: DreamCanvas
projects.description: AI-powered image generation playground with real-time editing capabilities

technicalDetails.frontend: React with TypeScript for type safety
technicalDetails.aiIntegration: Stable Diffusion API with custom parameters

features: Real-time image generation with progress updates
Dark/light theme with system preference detection

philosophy.approach: I believe in understanding technology from first principles. Whether building a physics engine or a distributed system, I start with the fundamentals and build up.
values: Deep technical understanding over surface-level knowledge
Building for real impact, not just demos
Clean, maintainable code over quick hacks

goals.shortTerm: Excel in upcoming Google internship and graduate with honors
goals.mediumTerm: Join a company where I can work on challenging technical problems at scale
goals.longTerm: Build products that positively impact millions of users
